sentence.Network_en: They were going to sail around the little island, against the tide.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们打算绕着小岛逆潮航行。

sentence.Network_en: She's going to be fine. She always was pretty strong.
sentence.Network_cn: 她会好的。她一直都很强壮。

sentence.Network_en: It's an uphill battle but I think we're going to win.
sentence.Network_cn: 虽然这是一场艰苦的斗争，但我相信我们会取得胜利。

PerfectNetExp.abs: I am going to study at the University of Calgary ., 我要到卡尔加里大学学习.
Besides , Jim and I are going to buy a house in the city ., 另外 , 我和吉姆准备在市中心买一套房子.
did you think that i was going to give it up to you - this time ., 你认为这次我会投降吗.
And I ' m going to study French at the same time ., 同时我也将学法语.

lj.lj_ly: The child is six, going on seven years of age.
lj.lj_ls: 这个孩子现在六岁，快到七岁了

entry.def: If you say that something is going to happen, you mean that it will happen in the future, usually quite soon.

example.ex: I think it's going to be successful...

entry.def: You say that you are going to do something to express your intention or determination to do it.

example.ex: I'm going to go to bed...
He announced that he's  going to resign...

entry.def: You use the going to talk about how easy or difficult it is to do something. You can also say that something is, for example, hard going or tough going .

example.ex: He has her support to fall back on when the going gets tough...
example.tran: 他在进展困难的时候可以求助于她。

example.ex: Though the talks had been hard going at the start, they had become more friendly.
example.tran: 虽然会谈在初期进行得很艰难，但是后来气氛变得友好些了。

entry.def: In horse racing and horse riding, when you talk about the going, you are talking about the condition of the surface the horses are running on.

example.ex: The going was soft; some horses found it hard work.
example.tran: 这块场地偏软，有一些马跑得很费劲。

entry.def: The going rate or the going salary is the usual amount of money that you expect to pay or receive for something.

example.ex: She says that's the going rate for a house this big...
example.tran: 她说这么大的房子现在就是这个价。

example.ex: That's about half the going price on world oil markets.
example.tran: 那大约相当于目前国际石油市场价格的一半。

entry.def: If someone or something has a lot going for them, they have a lot of advantages.

example.ex: This area has a lot going for it...
I wish I could show you the things you've got going for you.
example.tran: 我希望能让你看到自己的优势所在。

entry.def: When you get going, you start doing something or start a journey, especially after a delay.

example.ex: Now what about that shopping list? I've got to get going.
example.tran: 那张购物清单呢？我得出发了。

entry.def: If you say that someone should do something while the going is good, you are advising them to do it while things are going well and they still have the opportunity, because you think it will become much more difficult to do.

example.ex: People are leaving in their thousands while the going is good.
example.tran: 成千上万的人趁着局势稳定赶紧撤离。

entry.def: If you keep going, you continue doing things or doing a particular thing.

example.ex: I like to keep going. I hate to sit still.
example.tran: 我喜欢一直有事情做，讨厌一动不动地坐着。

entry.def: If you can keep going with the money you have, you can manage to live on it.

example.ex: Things were difficult, and we needed her wages to keep going.
example.tran: 日子很艰难，我们要靠她的工资来维持生活。

entry.def: If you say that something that has been achieved is good going or not bad going, you mean that it is better than usual or than expected.

example.ex: 4,000 copies of Wuthering Heights went in two days. That's not bad going for a book that has been on the market for 145 years.
example.tran: 4,000册《呼啸山庄》在两天内销售一空，对于一本已经面市145年的书而言，这是一个不错的成绩。

entry.def: If you say that something is enough to be going on with, you mean that it is enough for your needs at the moment, although you will need something better at some time in the future.

example.ex: It was a good enough description for Mattie to be going on with.
example.tran: 这个描述对玛蒂来说暂时还不错。

entry.def: You can use going on before a number to say that something has almost reached that number. For example, you can say that someone is going on 40 to indicate that they are nearly 40.

example.ex: We've been married for going on two years...

example.en: After a going over like that，the guy spent two weeks in the hospital.
example.zh: 挨了 那样一顿痛打后，那家伙住了两个星期医院。

example.en: I gave your car a good going over, and I fixed a lot of little things.
example.zh: 我把你的车仔细检查了一下，修好了许多小东西。

auth_sentence.content: Which means Mary What are you going to wear?
auth_sentence.res_content: Which means Mary What are you going to wear?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Which means Mary What are you going to wear?

auth_sentence.content: They will tell us what is going to happen.
auth_sentence.res_content: They will tell us what is going to happen.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They will tell us what is going to happen.

sentences.en: Her going on maternity leave will create a temporary vacancy.
sentences.cn: 她休产假时将会有一个临时空缺。

sentences.en: ‘It only took me two hours to get to Birmingham.’ ‘That’s good going.
sentences.cn: ’ “我只花两个小时就到了伯明翰。”“那很快。”

means.word_mean: 接近(某个年龄、时刻或数目)；几乎

sentences.en: It was going on for midnight by the time we left.
‘I’ve written 20 pages today.’ ‘That’s not bad going.’
sentences.cn: “ 我今天写了20页。”“ 不错啊。”

means.word_mean: 暂且够用；足够维持一段时间

sentences.en: ￡50 should be enough to be going on with.
sentences.cn: 50 英镑应该够用一段时间了。

means.word_mean: 有很多(或一些、没有等)成绩(或技能、优势等)

sentences.en: As the very intelligent daughter of rich parents, she’s got a lot going for her.
sentences.cn: 出身富家又天资聪颖，她拥有很多优势。

sentences.en: No job, no qualifications, nowhere to live. He doesn’t have much going for him, does he?
sentences.cn: 没有工作，没有资历，又没有住处。他真是没什么优势可言，是吧？

means.word_mean: 趁情况尚可时；趁局势还有利时

sentences.en: He thinks the company is going to go bankrupt soon, so he’s getting out while the going is good.
sentences.cn: 他认为公司即将破产，所以就趁境况还没变糟之前抽身退出。

sentences.en: Don’t you think we should quit while the going is good?
sentences.cn: 难道你不觉得我们应该及早脱身吗？
